alert.note: Alert for Craig; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Rogers; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Craig, northwestern Rogers, Osage, northern Ottawa, Washington, Nowata and Pawnee Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 657 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated an outflow of strong winds along a line extending from 5 miles west of Chetopa to 2 miles southeast of Dewey to near Ralston. The winds extended ahead of a broken line of storms moving into northeast Oklahoma from Kansas. Gusty winds are possible both with the outflow and closer to the individual storms. Movement of the storms was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... Miami... Baxter Springs... Nowata... Pawhuska... Pawnee... Hominy... Dewey... Cleveland... Commerce... Fairfax... Barnsdall... Quapaw... South Coffeyville... Copan... Welch... Ramona... Shidler... Wynona... Ochelata... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 302 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Rogers; Washington
